001package imagingbook.pub.color.quantize;
002
003import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
004
005import java.awt.image.IndexColorModel;
006
007import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
008import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
009import imagingbook.lib.color.RgbUtils;
010
011public interface ColorQuantizer {
012        
013        public final static int MAX_RGB = 255;
014        
015        /**
016         * Retrieves the color map produced by this color quantizer.
017         * The returned array is in the format float[idx][rgb], where
018         * rgb = 0 (red), 1 (green), 2 (blue) and  0 &le; idx &lt; nColors.
019         * 
020         * @return The table of reference (quantization) colors.
021         */
022        public abstract float[][] getColorMap();
023        
024        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
025        
026        /**
027         * Performs color quantization on the given full-color RGB image
028         * and creates an indexed color image.
029         * 
030         * @param cp The original full-color RGB image.
031         * @return The quantized (indexed color) image.
032         */
033        public default ByteProcessor quantize(ColorProcessor cp) {
034                float[][] colormap = this.getColorMap();
035                if (colormap.length > 256) 
036                        throw new RuntimeException("cannot index to more than 256 colors");
037                
038                int w = cp.getWidth();
039                int h = cp.getHeight();
040                
041                int[]  rgbPixels = (int[]) cp.getPixels();
042                byte[] idxPixels = new byte[rgbPixels.length];
043
044                for (int i = 0; i < rgbPixels.length; i++) {
045                        idxPixels[i] = (byte) findColorIndex(rgbPixels[i], colormap);
046                }
047
048                IndexColorModel idxCm = makeIndexColorModel(colormap);
049                return new ByteProcessor(w, h, idxPixels, idxCm);
050        }
051        
052        static IndexColorModel makeIndexColorModel(float[][] colormap) {
053                final int nColors = colormap.length;
054                byte[] rMap = new byte[nColors];
055                byte[] gMap = new byte[nColors];
056                byte[] bMap = new byte[nColors];
057                for (int i = 0; i < nColors; i++) {
058                        rMap[i] = floatToUnsignedByte(colormap[i][0]);
059                        gMap[i] = floatToUnsignedByte(colormap[i][1]);
060                        bMap[i] = floatToUnsignedByte(colormap[i][2]);
061                }
062                return new IndexColorModel(8, nColors, rMap, gMap, bMap);
063        }
064        
065        static byte floatToUnsignedByte(float x) {
066                int xi = Math.round(x);
067                if (xi < 0) {
068                        xi = 0;
069                }
070                else if (xi > MAX_RGB) {
071                        xi = MAX_RGB;
072                }
073                return (byte) (0xFF & xi);
074        }
075        
076//      /**
077//       * Performs color quantization on the given sequence of
078//       * ARGB-encoded color values and returns a new sequence 
079//       * of quantized colors.
080//       * 
081//       * @param origPixels The original ARGB-encoded color values.
082//       * @return The quantized ARGB-encoded color values.
083//       */
084//      public int[] quantize(int[] origPixels) {
085//              int[] qantPixels = new int[origPixels.length];
086//              for (int i = 0; i < origPixels.length; i++) {
087//                      qantPixels[i] = quantize(origPixels[i]);
088//              }
089//              return qantPixels;
090//      }
091        
092//      /**
093//       * Performs color quantization on the given ARGB-encoded color 
094//       * value and returns the associated quantized color. 
095//       * @param p The original ARGB-encoded color value.
096//       * @return The quantized ARGB-encoded color value.
097//       */
098//      public int quantize(int p) {
099//              int[][] colormap = getColorMap();
100//              int idx = findColorIndex(p);
101//              int red = colormap[idx][0];
102//              int grn = colormap[idx][1];
103//              int blu = colormap[idx][2];
104//              return RgbUtils.rgbToInt(red, grn, blu);
105//      }
106        
107        /**
108         * Finds the color table index of the color that is "closest" to the supplied
109         * RGB color (minimum Euclidean distance in color space). 
110         * This method may be overridden by inheriting classes, for example, to use
111         * quick indexing in the octree method.
112         *  
113         * @param p Original color, encoded as an ARGB integer.
114         * @param colormap a color map (float)
115         * @return The associated color table index.
116         */
117        default int findColorIndex(int p, float[][] colormap) {
118//              float[][] colormap = getColorMap();
119                int[] rgb = RgbUtils.intToRgb(p);
120                int n = colormap.length;
121                float minD2 = Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
122                int minIdx = -1;
123                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
124                        final float red = colormap[i][0];
125                        final float grn = colormap[i][1];
126                        final float blu = colormap[i][2];
127                        float d2 = sqr(red - rgb[0]) + sqr(grn - rgb[1]) + sqr(blu - rgb[2]);   // dist^2
128                        if (d2 < minD2) {
129                                minD2 = d2;
130                                minIdx = i;
131                        }
132                }
133                return minIdx;
134        }
135        
136        default void listColorMap() {
137                float[][] colormap = getColorMap();
138                System.out.println("listColorMap: " + colormap.length);
139                int n = colormap.length;
140                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
141                        float red = colormap[i][0];
142                        float grn = colormap[i][1];
143                        float blu = colormap[i][2];
144                        System.out.println(String.format("i=%3d: r=%6.1f g=%6.1f b=%6.1f", i, red, grn, blu));
145                }
146        }
147        
148        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
149        
150//      protected int log2(int n){
151//              if(n <= 0) throw new IllegalArgumentException();
152//              return 31 - Integer.numberOfLeadingZeros(n);
153//      }
154        
155//      protected int sqr(int k) {
156//              return k * k;
157//      }
158
159}
